p.s: The text Hope of escape lost in translation which was published in the Sunday Times magazine on December 17th, 2016 and written by Zia Haider Rahman is about immigration from BangladeshiBangladesh to the UK.
Rahman shows the problems and his experiences being an immigrant from Bangladesh in the UK.
In London you got a Bangladeshi district where English is a foreign language and even the street signs are in Bengali.
Also most of the people that are living there are at the bottom of educational environment.
So drug abuse and crime is on the rise in this district.
If you are a young Bangladeshi male, with no hope of employment, you can choose between extremists in the mosque or gang crime in the streets.
The problem is that the Bangladeshi people don't get immigrated they have to learn everything by themselves.
And that's why most of the immigrants can't speak englishEnglish very well.
Another big problem is racism because some people don't accept refugees because they think that they are something different.
So refugees are confronted with racicsmracism every single day.
The author's experiences with getting immigrated shows that if you really want to integrate yourself, it could be done.
His parents wanted him to learn English, because they don't wanted to be absorbed by the Bangladeshi district which was like the country they left.
Also the parents wanted him to do a good job in school.
It's important to see that in the mid 1970s, the teachers didn't make an acknowledgement of the author's racial difference.
Because today it's celebrated by schools although the author isn't convinced that celebrating differences can help getting someone integrated.
Because everyone is the same and if you treat someone like he's something different because of a cultural difference, it don'tdoesn't helpshelp getting this person immigrated.
Also, you don't have to celebrate the diversity of only a couple of people, you have to celebrate the diversity of everyone.
Another big problem is social media.
Because publigpublic figures are fearful being labelled as a racist if they don't speak up for organisations against racism.
So they are under very big pressure to keep their image good.
The text shows us major problem because bad integration and racism isn't something that only exists in the UK, it exists in every country and it's very important to do something against this problem.
